Articles.Content:
I just pressed "Control" because I thought the music was too loud.

On my earbuds.

That weren't connected to my computer, but to my iPhone.

To make it worse, just yesterday, I swear I saw a rocket take off into the sky in the early morning. I asked my friend "Did you see that?", and he replied "See what?", and I was like "That rocket", and he looked at me funny and murmured something

Dear Kerbin help me, I feel like my mind is going. Must have more KSP! Must into moonbase! Must into Laythe! Must to Moho!

MUST INTO SPACE!

I don't think this is a bad thing

On a side note, if you go way out away from the city at night and look up, eventually you'll notice quite a few satellites. And if you see a real big one that starts to get brighter and it freaks you out and makes all your family laugh at you, it might just be the ISS.
I hit F5 at work to save a Word document and wondered for a second why it didn't work.

I hit F5 at work to save a Word document and wondered for a second why it didn't work.

Totally needs to be the new shortcut to save on Word.
Uh oh... I think there is a hick-up in the Matrix

I had something similar like this happen to me. I looked up into the sky one day and thought I saw comet ISON(this was back in December) and I took a picture and put it on facebook but then after a few minutes I realized it was just a cloud...
You never know. I thought I saw a rocket flying, then explode, and my friend thought I was nuts. I found out the next day I watched a successful missile interception.

You never know. I thought I saw a rocket flying, then explode, and my friend thought I was nuts. I found out the next day I watched a successful missile interception.

I wonder if NASA launches rockets at 6AM in an suburban town in Michigan. I kinda wish I live in New Mexico, they got an active space industry there, or better yet, near the NASA centers in Florida or Californa.
I have definitely remapped keys of other games to match KSP's; as that layout seems so much more natural to me now.

I wonder if NASA launches rockets at 6AM in an suburban town in Michigan. I kinda wish I live in New Mexico, they got an active space industry there, or better yet, near the NASA centers in Florida or Californa.

I used to drive through White Sands once a week. It doesn't happen often but you would get to see interesting things from time to time.

I used Blender for a bit a year or two back. Its controls are VERY different to anything else, and I did find myself trying to use Blender controls in other stuff.

More common, in Linux you can paste selected text by middle-clicking. I regularly try to do that in Windows.
I reluctantly admit to doing that too
